title: Can I call myself a published author? - Quora

response.answer_text: You can call yourself anything you want, but if you call yourself a writer and people find out you either haven’t written anything or that you’ve self-published it, they’ll just roll their eyes at you. Let me change that a little. The whole business is massively in flux right now and if I were to give you the standard answer from just a few years ago, I’d come off as a pompous idiot. Nowadays you can self-publish stuff and be considered a real published author, but your stuff would have to be read by a significant number of people and you’d have to make some money in the process. Let me change that a little too. If your stuff is getting published by a university press or a small press you’d be considered a real published author, even if you never see a centavo in earnings. A buddy of mine has published easily a dozen books by different university presses and other small publishing houses and yeah, he’s a real published author. But somebody thinks enough of his writings that they spend their money putting his writing into print. But if you’re doing it all on your nickel and nobody is buying and nobody is reading it, you’re not really a published writer, you’re just a fool and his (or her) monkey!

Yes I think that would qualify you as a published author, but be very careful. There are still a few authors(usually published through traditional publishing houses, who might take offense), but in my book you’re a published author. My qualifications are I went the self publishing route(not vanity), so I’m in the same boat as you, and may have to question my merits as an author. In the meantime I have 7 of them out there and even sold a few. If doing a book will make you feel better about your credentials as an author. You could put some of your magazine stuff in a print on demand paperback book, upload it to Amazon/Kindle at no cost, then turn around and do it again as an e book. Now you are a published author of at least 3 mediums! Thanks! Robert

If you have published something and in regular fashion, yes! One novel or one non-fiction book, whether or not you did it self-published then you are an author. When it comes to publishing in magazines, or on a blog, or even answering questions on Quora, then you can only call yourself a published writer. The mediums in which you write are the defining feature of whether you are a writer or an author. Publish books, short stories, poetry and you can say you are a published author. If you publish short stories in literary magazines and have a body of work to show, if you stipulate to short story writing then you can call yourself a published short story author, and same goes with poetry in magazines, although the term you would use would be “published poet”.

Of course you can call yourself a published writer. You are. But calling yourself that sounds like bragging. So why not just tell people which places have printed your stuff? Of COURSE it qualifies. Instead of calling yourself anything, just tell people where you’ve been published. “’Modern Grocer’ ran my item on the way shelves are stocked” or “’The Journal of Nosebleeds’ published my article on ‘Altitudes’ affects on nasal capilaries’” … that sort of thing.

Can I call myself a published author? 've published numerous articles in magazines. Some are for sell, some are free. Some are national, some international. Does this qualify as “published author” or is this reserved for book writers? Nope. I got published long before I had a book come out, published for royalties. Only when I held a copy of that book was I an author. Those other clips were merely clips and meant f**** S*** regarding being an author. When someone calls him or herself an author, the next question is ‘what books have you had published.’ Heck, I was stunned that people who pay vanity presses could be called authors, and those who only have ebooks! Talk about stolen glory!  and this one I got for selling a magazine article, and magazines sorta are like books, being made of paper with ink on them, so I’m an Author!

Well, having researched the idea myself... I would say no. Published author, at least here in the U.S., is usually reserved for writers who have published a book, and it doesn't matter if it's self published or not. That said, what you could most definitely call yourself is a published writer because that's what you are. Good luck and congratulations on your success as a writer. I hope this helps:)

There isn’t a regulated definition of the term “published author.” In the book business, however, if you use that phrase, and you haven’t had a book published by a traditional house (at its own expense), then everyone who sees the claim will think very badly of you, indeed. In fact, the term “published author” is almost always used by people who don’t have solid credentials, even if they have been published by a mainstream house. I would avoid the phrase like plague, myself.

You can call yourself anything you like. For it to be true you must have published something somewhere. In these days of the internet, the definition of publish is pretty broad. You could have published your writing on your facebook page, your twitter account, a blog or the comment section of this or any website.
If you get paid you are a professional writer. If you get published, you are a published writer. I would reserve author for books, but not everyone agrees.
Yes. That qualifies you. Although you might think that anybody can write, not anybody can publish. You are a published author.

To be honest, and to put it legally its a book that makes a person into a published author but as times are evolving and world is moving towards information in short this perception can change.Allaah (God), knows the best
Yes I went the same route and if you're getting published it counts.
